name: The Global Round Table
goal:
The Global Round Table (GRT) was founded in 2004.

The Protector and High Patron of the GRT is H.E. Boutros Boutros-Ghali, UN Secretary General (1992â€“1996) and President of the International Panel on Democracy and Development.

GRT addresses issues of global importance that require more attention from political- and societal leaders, as well as issues that need to be approached from new and innovative perspectives.

The GRT is unique in that it is a non-party political initiative with the aim to:
i) identify new and emerging ideas of socio-economic importance;
ii) improve the level and quality of information available to economic- and political decision-makers; and
iii) inspire civil society leaders and the young generation.

Participation is strictly upon invitation.

Recipients of the GRT recommendations include:
- Heads of State;
- Members of the Group of Eight (G8);
- National Government Ministers;
- President of the European Parliament (EP) and Chairs of relevant EP Committees;
- President- and senior officials of the European Commission;
- President of the European Economic and Social Committee;
- National Academy Presidents;
- President of the European University Association;
- international entrepreneurs,
- academics/academic institutions;
- etc.
